header.title: JustDoBot Setup
header.subtitle: Configure your Telegram AI assistant
step1.title: Essentials
step1.subtitle: Core settings to get your bot running
step1.token.label: Telegram Bot Token
step1.token.hint: Get one from @BotFather
step1.userid.label: Telegram User ID
step1.userid.hint: Your numeric ID — send any message to @userinfobot to get it
step1.language.label: Bot Language
step1.language.hint: The language your bot will respond in
step2.title: AI Model
step2.subtitle: Choose the Claude model for your bot
step2.sonnet.name: Sonnet
step2.sonnet.desc: Fast and smart — great balance of speed and capability
step2.opus.name: Opus
step2.opus.desc: Most capable model, best for complex reasoning
step2.haiku.name: Haiku
step3.title: Integrations
step3.subtitle: Optional features — you can configure these later
step3.vault.title: Obsidian Vault
step3.vault.desc: Connect your Obsidian vault for knowledge search
step3.vault.path.label: Vault Path
step3.vault.path.hint: Absolute path to your Obsidian vault directory
step3.voice.title: Voice Messages
step3.voice.desc: Enable speech-to-text and text-to-speech for voice messages
step3.voice.gemini.label: Gemini API Key
step3.voice.tts.label: Text-to-Speech Provider
step3.voice.tts.hint: Choose how the bot generates voice replies
step3.voice.elevenlabs.key.label: ElevenLabs API Key
step3.voice.elevenlabs.voice.label: Voice ID
step3.voice.autoReply.label: Auto voice reply
step3.voice.autoReply.hint: Automatically send voice response to voice messages
step4.title: Proactive Behavior
step4.subtitle: Let the bot check in with you proactively
step4.proactive.title: Proactive Check-ins
step4.proactive.desc: Bot periodically checks your calendar, email, and goals, then decides if you need a nudge
step4.proactive.interval.label: Check Interval (minutes)
step4.proactive.interval.hint: How often the bot gathers data and decides whether to message you
step4.proactive.cooldown.label: Cooldown (minutes)
step4.proactive.reminderCooldown.label: Goal Reminder Cooldown (minutes)
step4.proactive.reminderCooldown.hint: How long to wait before reminding about the same goal again
step4.proactive.quiet.label: Quiet Hours
step4.proactive.quiet.hint: No proactive messages during this period
step4.google.title: Google Integration
step4.google.desc: Connect Gmail and Google Calendar as data sources
step4.google.clientId.label: Google Client ID
step4.google.clientSecret.label: Google Client Secret
step4.google.credentialsRequired: Enter Client ID and Secret first
step5.title: Code Agent
step5.subtitle: Let the bot write code in an isolated Docker sandbox
step5.codeAgent.title: Code Agent
step5.codeAgent.desc: Write code, build projects, and run tests in an isolated Docker sandbox
step5.codeAgent.model.label: Coding Model
step5.codeAgent.model.hint: The Claude model used for coding tasks (independent of your chat model)
step5.codeAgent.turns.label: Max Turns
step5.codeAgent.turns.hint: Maximum Claude Code tool-use rounds per task (5–200)
step5.codeAgent.timeout.label: Timeout (minutes)
step5.codeAgent.dockerStatus.notAvailabl: Docker not detected — required for code execution
step6.title: Save & Run
step6.subtitle: Review your configuration and launch
step6.summary.heading: Configuration Summary
step6.success.title: Configuration Saved
step6.launch.note: First launch may take a couple of minutes
step6.alt.label: For development, run directly:
error.token.serverDown: Could not reach server. Is the setup server running?
error.userid.numeric: User ID must be a number
error.save.serverDown: Could not reach server. Is the setup server running?
status.notDetected: Not detected (Docker will need manual setup)
claudeAuth.missing: Claude not authenticated — required for the bot to work
claudeAuth.stillMissing: Still not detected. Complete the login flow first.
claudeAuth.modal.title: Claude Authentication Required
claudeAuth.modal.description: JustDoBot requires Claude CLI credentials to function. Without them, the bot cannot start.
claudeAuth.modal.step1.title: Open a terminal
claudeAuth.modal.step1.desc: Open Terminal.app (macOS) or your terminal emulator (Linux)
claudeAuth.modal.step2.title: Run claude login
claudeAuth.modal.step3.title: Complete browser flow
claudeAuth.modal.step3.desc: Your browser will open. Log in to your Anthropic account and authorize Claude Code.
claudeAuth.modal.step4.title: Return here and re-check
claudeAuth.modal.step4.desc: After login completes, click the button below to verify.
step5.docker.guide.title: Install Docker
step5.docker.guide.mac.text: Install Docker Desktop via Homebrew or download directly:
step5.docker.guide.linux.text: Install Docker Engine using the official convenience script:
